definition: to offer (tribute)/to present respectfully (to superior, ancestor, deity etc)/to esteem/to revere/to believe in (a religion)/to wait upon/to accept orders (from superior)
to deliver/to carry/to give (as a present)/to present (with)/to see off/to send

sentences.english: Rice cakes and giving each other the gift, to enhance the friends and relatives of love.
sentences.chinese: 年糕又是互相奉送的礼品，来增长亲友挚友之情。

sentences.english: We are now sending you our catalog together with some samples of the materials you require.
sentences.chinese: 我方随函奉送贵方所要的产品目录及有关布样。

sentences.english: You can have the piano for 60, and I'll throw in the stool as well.
sentences.chinese: 这架钢琴可以卖给你60英镑，琴凳我奉送。

sentences.english: We enclose herewith our detailed quotation.
We gave this book to thank a little.
sentences.chinese: 我们奉送此书聊表谢意。

sentences.english: But some cookies are now serving up some surprisinglydownbeat advice.
sentences.chinese: 但是现在有些饼干开始奉送一些惊人的负面建议。

sentences.english: He occupies four rent-controlled apartments in New York, courtesy of a developer.
sentences.chinese: 他占据了开发商奉送的纽约四个租金受管制的公寓。

sentences.english: This book is a small token of our gratitude.
sentences.chinese: 我们奉送此书聊表谢意。

sentences.english: The supermarket is giving away a box of sugar to everyone who comes today.
sentences.chinese: 超等市场正在向本日来的每位主顾奉送一盒糖。

definition: to return with thanks/to give back (honorific)
lit. presenting the Buddha with borrowed flowers (idiom); fig. to win favor or influence using sb else's property/plagiarism
to send/to give as a present
gift given to sb when meeting them for the first time
to give a present/to accord (a favor)/to grant
(honorific) to present/to give as a present
